value.title: Cerebras puts ‘world’s largest computer chip’ in Lassen supercomputer
value.excerpt: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory said it has integrated Cerebras Systems' wafer-scale computer chip into its Lassen supercomputer.

value.title: Intel: Data bandwidth, sparsity are the two biggest challenges for AI chips
value.excerpt: The movement of data into and out of the processor is the biggest challenge for AI chips, but sparsity looms as an even greater challenge, according to Intel engineers.

value.title: IBM POWER10 Mega Chip For Hybrid Cloud Is Revealed
value.excerpt: The IBM POWER architecture has always delivered high-performance computing for business-critical workloads and looking to build on that legacy, they’ve just released the POWER10, tilting toward support for cloud workloads.

value.title: IBM Inks Deal With Samsung to Build its Latest Chip Processor
value.excerpt: International Business Machines Corporation IBM recently unveiled its latest chip processor — IBM POWER 10 — which will be manufactured by Samsung Electronics. The chip is primarily meant for use across data center operations and will be based on Samsung’s 7-nanometer (nm) process technology.

value.title: IBM unveils its first seven-nanometre chip for next-generation hybrid cloud computing
value.excerpt: IBM has announced the tenth generation of its flagship Power processors, a smaller, faster, more energy-efficient seven-nanometre chip that businesses can expect to deploy inside their data centres in the second half of 2021.
